PM25.long_description: The PM 2.5 indicator is a measure of potential exposure to inhalable particles that are 2.5 micrometers or smaller.
PM25.short_description: PM 2.5 levels in air, µg/m3 annual average
PM25.statement: The annual average concentration of Particulate Matter 2.5 in air in {features.name} is {value}.

OZONE.long_description: The ozone indicator is the potential ozone exposure measured in terms of summer seasonal daily average maximum concentrations in an 8-hour period measured in parts per billion.
OZONE.short_description: Ozone summer seasonal average of daily maximum 8-hour concentration in air in parts per billion
OZONE.statement: The summer daily average concentration of Ozone in an 8-hour period in {features.name} is {value}.

DSLPM.long_description: Diesel particulate matter is a component of diesel exhaust that includes soot particles made up primarily of carbon, ash, metallic abrasion particles, sulfates and silicates.
DSLPM.long_name: Diesel Particulate Matter level in air
DSLPM.short_description: Diesel particulate matter level in air, µg/m3
DSLPM.statement: The Diesel Particulate Matter level in air in {features.name} is {value}.

CANCER.long_description: The air toxics cancer risk indicator is the estimated lifetime inhalation cancer risk from the analyzed carcinogens in ambient outdoor air, as provided by the 2017 Air Toxics data update.
CANCER.short_description: Lifetime cancer risk from inhalation of air toxics
CANCER.statement: The Air Toxics Cancer Risk in {features.name} is {value}-in-1 million over 70 years.

RESP.long_description: The air toxics respiratory hazard index (HI) indicator is the respiratory HI from the analyzed carcinogens in ambient outdoor air, as provided by the 2017 Air Toxics Data Update.
RESP.short_description: Ratio of exposure concentration to health-based reference concentration
RESP.statement: The Air Toxics Respiratory Hazard Index in {features.name} is {value}, where values less or equal to 1 are not likely to result in noncancer adverse effects.

PTRAF.long_description: Residential proximity to traffic has been associated with various health impacts: asthma exacerbation and possibly onset and mortality; prevalence of coronary vascular disease as well as mortality; and coronary heart disease.
PTRAF.short_description: Count of vehicles (avg. annual daily traffic) at major roads within 500 meters, divided by distance in meters.
PTRAF.statement: The Traffic Proximity Index in {features.name} is {value}.

PRE1960.long_description: The age of housing stock serves as a proxy for potential lead exposure based on regulations banning residential lead-based paint that went into effect in 1978.
PRE1960.long_name: Number of occupied housing units built pre-1960
PRE1960.short_description: Number of occupied of housing units built pre-1960, as an indicator of potential lead paint exposure
PRE1960.statement: The number of pre-1960 occupied housing units in {features.name} is {value}.

PRE1960PCT.long_description: The age of housing stock serves as a proxy for potential lead exposure based on regulations banning residential lead-based paint that went into effect in 1978.
PRE1960PCT.long_name: Percentage of occupied housing units built pre-1960
PRE1960PCT.short_description: Percentage of occupied housing units built pre-1960, as indicator of potential lead paint exposure
PRE1960PCT.statement: The percentage of pre-1960 occupied housing units in {features.name} is {value}.

PNPL.long_description: The superfund proximity index is the total count of sites proposed and listed on the NPL in each block group within 5 km of the average resident in a block group, divided by distance, calculated as the population-weighted average of blocks in each block group.
PNPL.long_name: Proximity to Superfund (National Priorities List (NPL)) sites
PNPL.short_description: Count of proposed or listed NPL - also known as superfund - sites within 5 km (or nearest one beyond 5 km), each divided by distance in kilometers
PNPL.statement: The Superfund Proximity Index in {features.name} is {value}.

PRMP.long_description: The RMP facility proximity is the total count of RMP facilities in each block group within 5 km of the average resident in a block group, divided by distance, calculated as the population-weighted average of blocks in each block group.
PRMP.long_name: Proximity to Risk Management Plan (RMP) Facilities Index
PRMP.short_description: Count of RMP facilities (facilities that use extremely hazardous substances) within 5 km (or nearest one beyond 5 km), each divided by distance in kilometers
PRMP.statement: The Risk Management Plan Facility Proximity Index in {features.name} is {value}.

PTSDF.long_description: The hazardous waste proximity indicator is the total count of hazardous waste facilities in each block group within 5 km of the average resident in a block group, divided by distance, calculated as the population-weighted average of blocks in each block group.
PTSDF.long_name: Proximity to Treatment Storage and Disposal (TSDF) and Large Quanity Generators (LQG) Facilities Index
PTSDF.short_description: Count of hazardous waste facilities (TSDFs and LQGs) within 5 km (or nearest beyond 5 km), each divided by distance in kilometers
PTSDF.statement: The Hazardous Waste Proximity Index in {features.name} is {value}.

UST.long_description: The UST indicator quantifies the relative risk of being affected by a LUST for a block group. The indicator is derived by the weighted sum of active LUSTs and sum of active and temporarily out of service USTs within a certain distance from a block group.
UST.long_name: Underground Storage Tanks (UST) and Leaking UST (LUST) Risk Index
UST.short_description: The number of LUSTs (multiplied by a factor of 7.7) and the number of USTs within a 1,500-foot buffered block group
UST.statement: The relative risk from Underground Storage Tanks in {features.name} is {value}.

PWDIS.long_description: The wastewater discharge indicator quantifies a block group’s relative risk of exposure to pollutants in water bodies. This is achieved using toxicity-weighted concentrations in stream reach segments within 500 meters of a block centroid, divided by distance in meters, presented as the population-weighted average of blocks in each block group.
PWDIS.long_name: Index for major direct dischargers to water
PWDIS.short_description: Risk-Screening Environmental Indicator (RSEI) modeled toxic concentrations at stream segments within 500 meters, divided by distance in kilometers
PWDIS.statement: The relative risk from Wastewater Discharge in {features.name} is {value}.

D_PM25_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (national percentiles).
D_PM25_2.long_name: EJ Index for Particulate Matter 2.5 level in air
D_PM25_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Particulate Matter 2.5 is {value} (national percentiles).

D_OZONE_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_OZONE_2.long_name: EJ Index for Ozone level in air
D_OZONE_2.short_description: Ozone summer seasonal average of daily maximum 8-hour concentration in air in parts per billion
D_OZONE_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Ozone is {value} (national percentiles).

D_DSLPM_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_DSLPM_2.long_name: EJ Index for Diesel Particulate Matter level in air
D_DSLPM_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Diesel Particulate Matter is {value} (national percentiles).

D_CANCR_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_CANCR_2.long_name: EJ Index for Air Toxics Cancer Risk
D_CANCR_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Air Toxics Cancer Risk is {value} (national percentiles).

D_RESP_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_RESP_2.long_name: EJ Index for Air Toxics Respiratory Hazard Index
D_RESP_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Air Toxics Respiratory Hazard is {value} (national percentiles).

D_PTRAF_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_PTRAF_2.long_name: EJ Index for Traffic Proximity and Volume Proximity
D_PTRAF_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Traffic Proximity is {value} (national percentiles).

D_LDPNT_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_LDPNT_2.long_name: EJ Index for percentage of pre-1960 housing (lead paint indicator)
D_LDPNT_2.short_name: EJ Index for lead paint proxy
D_LDPNT_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Lead Paint is {value} (national percentiles).

D_PNPL_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_PNPL_2.long_name: EJ Index for Proximity to Superfund (National Priorities List (NPL)) sites
D_PNPL_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Superfund Proximity is {value} (national percentiles).

D_PRMP_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_PRMP_2.long_name: EJ Index for Proximity to Risk Management Plan (RMP) Facilities
D_PRMP_2.short_name: EJ Index for RMP Facility Proximity
D_PRMP_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Proximity to Risk Management Plan facilities is {value} (national percentiles).

D_PTSDF_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_PTSDF_2.long_name: EJ Index for Proximity to Treatment Storage and Disposal (TSDF) facilities
D_PTSDF_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Proximity to Treatment Storage and Disposal (TSDF) facilities is {value} (national percentiles).

D_UST_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_UST_2.long_name: EJ Index for Risk from Underground Storage Tanks (UST) and Leaking UST (LUST)
D_UST_2.short_name: EJ Index for Risk from Underground Storage Tanks
D_UST_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Risk from Underground Storage Tanks is {value} (national percentiles).

D_PWDIS_2.long_description: The EJ index is calculated for every census tract for each of the 12 environmental indicators. The index is the average of two demographic indicators: percent low-income and percent people of color, times the percentile of the environmental indicator (percentile based on nationwide data).
D_PWDIS_2.long_name: EJ Index for Risk from Major Direct Dischargers to Water
D_PWDIS_2.short_name: EJ Index for Risk from Wastewater Discharge
D_PWDIS_2.statement: In {features.name} the EJ Index for Risk from Wastewater Discharge is {value} (national percentiles).

PM25_QRT.long_description: The PM 2.5 indicator is a measure of potential exposure to inhalable particles that are 2.5 micrometers or smaller.
PM25_QRT.short_description: PM 2.5 levels in air, µg/m3 annual average
PM25_QRT.statement: In {features.name} the Particulate Matter 2.5 concentration is in the {value} quartile (National Capital Region quartiles).

OZONE_QRT.long_description: The ozone indicator is the potential ozone exposure measured in terms of summer seasonal daily average maximum concentrations in an 8-hour period measured in parts per billion.
OZONE_QRT.short_description: Ozone summer seasonal average of daily maximum 8-hour concentration in air in parts per billion
OZONE_QRT.statement: In {features.name} the Ozone concentration is in the {value} quartile (National Capital Region quartiles).

DSLPM_QRT.statement: In {features.name} the Diesel Particulate Matter concentration is in the {value} quartile (National Capital Region quartiles).

PNPL_QRT.long_name: Proximity to Superfund (National Priorities List (NPL)) sites
PNPL_QRT.short_description: Count of proposed or listed NPL - also known as superfund - sites within 5 km (or nearest one beyond 5 km), each divided by distance in kilometers
PNPL_QRT.statement: In {features.name} the Superfund Proximity Index is in the {value} quartile (National Capital Region quartiles).

PTSDF_QRT.long_name: Proximity to Treatment Storage and Disposal (TSDF) and Large Quanity Generators (LQG) Facilities Index
PTSDF_QRT.short_description: Count of hazardous waste facilities (TSDFs and LQGs) within 5 km (or nearest beyond 5 km), each divided by distance in kilometers
PTSDF_QRT.statement: In {features.name} the Hazardous Waste Proximity Index is in the {value} quartile (National Capital Region quartiles).

UST_QRT.long_name: Underground Storage Tanks (UST) and Leaking UST (LUST) Risk Index
UST_QRT.short_description: The number of LUSTs (multiplied by a factor of 7.7) and the number of USTs within a 1,500-foot buffered block group
UST_QRT.statement: In {features.name} the Underground Storage Tanks Risk Index is in the {value} quartile (National Capital Region quartiles).
